name: Ngozi Okafor
description: Ngozi is a passionate advocate for preserving African culture and heritage. As CEO, she leads efforts to promote African history through dynamic exhibitions and educational programs.

name: Kwame Nkrumah
description: Kwame oversees the museum's collections and curates exhibitions that highlight the richness of African art, history, and traditions.

name: Amina Mbeki
description: Amina is dedicated to developing educational programs that bring African cultural heritage to life for visitors of all ages. She works closely with schools and communities.

name: Thabo Modise
description: Thabo ensures the smooth operation of the museum, from coordinating exhibitions to managing logistics. His goal is to create an accessible and enjoyable visitor experience.

name: Zuri Nia
description: Zuri leads the marketing team and crafts campaigns to engage the public and raise awareness about the museum’s cultural initiatives and exhibitions.

name: Sibongile Khumalo
description: Sibongile manages the museum’s finances, ensuring that resources are allocated efficiently to support programs and community outreach efforts.
